feature_description: Locate a specific file by its name
env_setup:
#Initial clean-up
Execute rm -r ~/Desktop/oi/* to start with fresh test directory.
# Navigate to the test directory
cd ~/Desktop/oi
# Create a nested directory structure
mkdir -p projects/archived/2022
mkdir -p projects/active/planning
mkdir -p documents/reference
# Place the target file in a nested location
echo "Project Proposal Content" > projects/archived/2022/project_proposal.pdf
prompt: Can you help me find a PDF file called project_proposal.pdf? It should be somewhere in this directory structure but I can't remember where I put it.
expected_behaviour: The agent should execute a search command like `find ~/Desktop/oi -name "project_proposal.pdf"` to locate the file. It should report that the file is located at ~/Desktop/oi/projects/archived/2022/project_proposal.pdf. Achieving a similar outcome using any reasonable method is perfectly acceptable.
